title: Was Pyke's name inspired from Game of Thrones?

embed.description: This article is about the castle. For the large island, see "Pyke (island)". Pyke is the stronghold and seat of House Greyjoy, located on the island of the same name, which is one of the seven major Iron Islands. The castle is the regional capital of the Iron Islands as a whole.

body:
I am LOVING this new champion (what we've seen so far)! So good! The darker thematic along with the music and lore that's sure to come is thrilling! But being an avid Game of Thrones fan, I noticed that Pyke is very similar to the characterization of the Greyjoys in Game of Thrones. 
1. Their religion follows The **Drowned **God. Pyke (LoL champ) apparently drowns his victims. 
2. Their castle (and 1 of the islands of the Iron Islands) is named **Pyke**. Pyke's name is... Pyke. 
3. They're the closest thing Westeros has to **pirates **and/or Vikings because they pillage, plunder, etc. due to their lack of farming abilities. Bilgewater = pirates and merchants who trade because they do not produce on their own. 

I am LOVING the similarities and am really hoping this is where you all found your muse!

Miss Fortune {{champion:21}}  is probably one of my favorite champs overall and I can NOT WAIT to see where you all take Bilgewater in the next few weeks! {{champion:41}} {{champion:104}} {{champion:420}} {{champion:4}} {{champion:111}}

replies.body:
Pyke's narrative writer here. While it's not a direct reference or inspiration in any way, we are obviously GoT fans.  It's more of an homage to Mr. Martin and the constant badassery of GoT.

edit: plus we all just loved the name.
Love it!!!! It totally fits! Love all parts of this new champ (and of course, GoT!)!

Name wise, I'm not sure they put as much thought it in as you think.

Pike is a fish that comes from the sea, plus pike is also a type of long weapon that 'heads' are displayed on after execution, he's kinda after the same thing. They changed a letter so it's the same sounding word.

Characterisation wise, dunno, don't watch GoT.

Respectfully, I'd have to disagree. Riot vets every name in multiple languages and in every country. If there's some sort of conflict, they have to know ahead of time before releasing it to the world. So I'm sure they had to have known about a very popular (be it extremely nerdy) television show in pop culture right now. I'd be willingly to bet that a lot of people at Riot are even fans! 

And definitely! Pike is a fish and I'm sure George RR Martin knew that too when he named his fictional location. A lot of fictional literature gets its ideas from real world aspects... We work with what we know. So I agree! I'm sure there are other reasons like a fish or a weapon but I'm just pointing out the HUGE similarities b/t two of my loves! Lol

> [{quoted}](name=ScubaVampire,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=ipcA4c0p,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-05-11T10:22:21.804+0000)
>
> Respectfully, I'd have to disagree. Riot vets every name in multiple languages and in every country. If there's some sort of conflict, they have to know ahead of time before releasing it to the world. So I'm sure they had to have known about a very popular (be it extremely nerdy) television show in pop culture right now. I'd be willingly to bet that a lot of people at Riot are even fans! 
> 
> And definitely! Pike is a fish and I'm sure George RR Martin knew that too when he named his fictional location. A lot of fictional literature gets its ideas from real world aspects... We work with what we know. So I agree! I'm sure there are other reasons like a fish or a weapon but I'm just pointing out the HUGE similarities b/t two of my loves! Lol

You can disagree, that's what internet discussions are for. :P I just don't think GoT had an influence on the name. 'Pyke' the word only has references as a name, befor GOT, just a surname. Taking a Surname and making it a name of a character is easy, as it could have been his surname not given name. The idea of 'from the sea' and how pikes are using in killing people, work too. You could be right too, I'm just not sure (unlike early development of the game) they take as much input from popular culture as they once did.

Pyke also doesn't have meaning in other languages unlike 'pike', the fish or weapon. So it's easily transfered to other languages.



Although, I'm not sure how much thought they really put, they named Nami... Nami which means Wave in Japanese. The next Marai they bring out they'll probably call Shio (Tide) The Wave Shaper.

... that's not a bad character concept, I might work on that.

Reav3 mentioned that name Pyke was not inspired by ASoIaF.

["It was just a cool name we thought fit his personality and theme, wasn't inspired from GoT at all."](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/8iggxc/pyke_the_bloodharbor_ripper_champion_teaser/dyrt6tw/?context=3)

Right?
Somewhere in the back of my mind i thought of GoT... 
He reminds of the infected that spread greyscale that sir jorah had :// 
and also he reminds me of the pirates somewhat
He should have a skin similar to Greywick. Grey Pyke. It would bring much joy to the GoT fans.
Pyke seems like a common surname, it has barely anything to do with GOT other our perceptions of them both revolving around water and drowning beliefs.
after all the GOT that was put into Swain, i'd just say yeah
